item.title: Permutation p-value approximation
item.description:
In this PhD project, I develop an approach for accurate p-value approximation in permutation testing using the GPD (Generalized Pareto Distribution) while strictly avoiding zero p-values. The proposed p-value approximation framework, including precise fitting of GPD parameters, tail threshold detection, and multiple testing adjustment, will be made available in the open-source R package permAprox on GitHub and CRAN.'

The project is carried out under the supervision of Anne-Laure Boulesteix and Christian L. M端ller, as well as in collaboration with the group of Prof.Dr. Erika von Mutius at the Helmholtz Zentrum M端nchen.

item.title: NetCoMi
item.description:
NetCoMi is an R package that provides an extensive toolbox for constructing, analyzing, and comparing networks for microbial compositional data. It also offers the ability to quantify network differences and thus enables insights into whether single taxa, groups of taxa, or the overall network structure change between groups.

The package was developed as part of my Ph.D. thesis, in collaboration with my supervisors and coauthors Anne-Laure Boulesteix and Christian L. M端ller, as well as the group of Prof.Dr. Erika von Mutius at the Helmholtz Zentrum M端nchen.

The manuscript describing the workflow and theory behind the package is published in Briefings in Bioinformatics.
